summary: coronaviruses are a family of enveloped viruses with positive sense, non-segmented, single-stranded RNA genomes. avian infectious bronchitis virus (IBV) reduces the performance of both meat-type and egg-laying chickens. some coronaviruses infect humans and account for a significant percentage of adult common colds. coronaviruses can cross species barrier to become lethal human pathogens. studies on coronaviruses are both economically and medically important. coronaviruses are spherical or pleomorphic in shape with a mean diameter 80–120 nm. the genome, ranging from 27,000 to 32,000 nucleotides in size, is the largest RNA genomes known to date. the genome, ranging from 27,000 to 32,000 nucleotides in size, is the largest RNA genomes known to date. replicase gene consists of two open reading frames (ORF1a and ORF1b) translation of replicase polyprotein 1a produces 11 non-structural proteins (nsp1–nsp11), while pp1ab produces 15 non-structural proteins (nsp1–nsp10 and nsp12–nsp16). replicase synthesizes negative sense genomic RNAs. replicase synthesizes nested set of subgenomic RNAs. sgRNAs are used as templates for synthesizing positive sense RNA genomes.
